Title: 🖼 Another air bomb was dropped by the Russian Aerospace Forces o...
Description: Another aerial bomb was dropped by the Russian Aerospace Forces on the Belgorod Region According to ASTRA sources in the emergency services of the Belgorod Region, on October 17, a FAB was found near the village of Sergievka, Krasnoyaruzhsky District. After this update, FABs now have wings and satellite guidance, allowing them to launch bombs directly from Russian territory. Previously confirmation of the use of the winged FAB-3000 in Ukraine was published. The numbers in the name of such bombs indicate the total weight of the product.The Russian army began actively using the UMPC in the spring of this year. And the problem of the updated FABs immediately emerged - often the bombs simply do not reach Ukraine. According to ASTRA estimates, in total, from March to September, Russian planes dropped at least 128 aerial bombs on Russia and the occupied territories of Ukraine. FAB-250 and FAB-500 fall most often. Usually, in case of emergency, they do not explode - the bombs are destroyed after the fact by explosives technicians. At the beginning of July, FAB-3000 fell for the first time from a Russian plane in the Belgorod region. A bomb exploded in a field near Shebekino. Since the bomb fell in a field, there were no casualties. May 4 a Russian plane dropped a FAB-500 on Belgorod, as a result of which 7 people were injured, 31 households and 10 cars damaged. Title: 🖼 Over the past year, $5 billion worth of sanctioned goods have ...
Description: Over the past year, $5 billion worth of sanctioned goods -disappeared- in RussiaIn 2023, during transit through Russian territory, sanctioned goods -disappeared- on  five billion dollars that flowed from the European Union to the countries of Asia and the Caucasus, found out -Important stories.- According to the publication, over the past year, these countries from the EU sent sanctioned goods worth more than $14 billion, however, according to import data from these countries, goods worth just under 9 billion reached them dollars. This suggests that cargo worth $5 billion -disappeared- somewhere along the way.As an employee of a company that imports sanctioned goods into Russia said, the scheme works as follows: companies in Central Asia, in the Caucasus or China, orders goods from the EU and arranges land transit through Russia. The cargo is sent to the eastern border of the European Union, and when it ends up in the buffer zone, it is re-registered for import into the Russian Federation. At the same time, many sanctioned goods are imported into the Russian Federation not only through Belarus, but also from Latvia, Estonia and Finland. The source said that on average, sending a 20-ton truck from Poland to Russia will cost 5.5 thousand dollars, and transportation of the same volume through Turkey will cost about 11 thousand dollars. This scheme, among others, is used by the Russian microelectronics supplier Kvazar, which has been under American sanctions since May 2023. In total, last year the company imported approximately $10 million worth of goods directly from the European Union through Finnish customs . Большая часть этих товаров — примерно на 5,8 миллионов долларов — поступила после введения санкций против компании.

In this regard, he demanded that they be prosecuted for carrying out advertising activities without registration. Previously ASTRA wrote that Nikita Nosov, a resident of Vladivostok who returned from the war, who tried to kill himself because of extortion from the gypsies, could have cheated them out of money. Title: Searches took place today at no less than six doctors who support...

Title: 🖼 Six Russian deserters were given French visas Six Russian mili...
Description: Six Russian deserters were given French visasSix Russian military personnel were given temporary visas so they could apply for political asylum in France. This is the first time such a large group of deserters has been accepted into an EU country, writes The Guardian with reference to human rights organizations. According to the newspaper, the men arrived in Paris on separate flights over the past few months. Before that, they were in Kazakhstan, from where they fled the Russian Federation in 2022 and 2023. -France's decision is the result of extensive cooperation between the French authorities and a group of human rights organizations,- Ivan Chuvilyaev, a representative of the -Walk through the Forest- project, told the publication. -We hope this marks the beginning of more deserters being allowed into Europe.- He added that each of the soldiers was vetted for their -strong, consistent anti-war position- before they were allowed into France. Among those who received temporary visas were those who fought against Ukraine, as well as conscripts and officers who managed to avoid being sent to the front line.

Title: 🖼 A Russian chef arrested in France faces up to 30 years in pris...
Description: A Russian chef arrested in France faces up to 30 years in prison in the case of preparing riots during the Olympic Games The Paris prosecutor's office is investigating a criminal case against Russian citizen Kirill Gryaznov under the article on cooperation with a foreign state to organize unrest in France. Under this article, he faces up to 30 years in prison, RIA Novosti reports with reference to the Paris prosecutor's office.During the search, Gryaznov was found to have elements -allowing us to believe that he had the intention of organizing incidents that could cause destabilization during the Olympic Games.- Previously it was reported that Gryaznov, who performed on culinary TV shows, was recruited by Russian intelligence services for provocations at the Olympic Games in France, found out The Insider. On July 19, Gryaznov was arrested on charges of espionage. Some -diplomatic materials- and an identity card indicating membership in -Unit V- were found on him. On May 7, Gryaznov was supposed to go to Paris with a transfer in Istanbul, but he got very drunk - in Istanbul he was not put on the plane and was blacklisted. After that, he traveled by car from Turkey to Bulgaria, where he began to tell random people that he had gone to Paris for a reason, but on a secret mission. In response to skeptical views, Gryaznov showed some identification proving that he really was related to the special services. In front of witnesses, he called someone and reported that he had hired another Moldovan from Chisinau for the task and everything was going according to plan.

Title: 🖼 -I didn’t ask to teach my child to pull the trigger-, - In the...
Description: -I didn’t ask to teach my child to pull the trigger,- — In the Sverdlovsk region, the mother of a high school student was fined 30 thousand rubles after refusing to send her son to military trainingDuring the proceedings with the school, which involved the military registration and enlistment office, the police and the FSB, Yana Lisitsina was threatened to take her child away. About this reports -Novaya Gazeta-. Lisitsyna told the newspaper that she tried to protect her son from any military training at school. The woman planned that her son, instead of serving in the army, would go to alternative civilian service (ACS), and did not want her son to be -taught to pull the trigger.-On the eve of the training camp, in May 2024, Lisitsyna was summoned to the education department of the city of Berezovsky. -The representative of the commission said: -You know, it seems to us that you are a bad influence on your son. We will have conversations with him. We will question him in tests - psychological, socio-psychological... Do you understand how this will end?- I say: 'I don't understand.' He: ‘We can take the child away from you.’ I asked: ‘On what basis?’ He began to list some articles, but then the military commissar got involved,- the newspaper quotes Lisitsyna. The military commissar called the woman’s son a -draft dodger- and stated that the high school student -doesn’t want to defend the country- while -now bombs will fly on our heads.-According to the article about discrediting the army, a woman was fined because of her answer to the military commissar. Novaya Gazeta does not quote what was said verbatim because of the threat of being fined under the same article, but writes that the general meaning of the phrase was: -The country was not in any danger in February 2022.- However, as noted, in the protocol on discrediting Lisitsyna, completely different words were attributed that the woman did not utter. There are no audio recordings in the administrative file confirming her words. It is based on the testimony of the head of the city education department and the former former teacher of Lisitsyna’s son, who were present during the conversation with the military commissar. Later, representatives of the Ministry of Internal Affairs and an FSB officer tried to take the woman to court. The latter told Lisitsyna that-Our fight for Vanya could end badly because we contacted human rights activists. I recommended not to communicate with them.- Ultimately, the woman did not go to trial and was fined in absentia. -It seems to me that school should be a place where teachers are your child’s protectors. It’s terrible to realize that this is not so,- said Lisitsyna, who herself previously worked as a teacher in schools and kindergartens.

A representative of the public organization Roskomsvoboda, in a comment to ASTRA, said that in this way the department probably decided to make the register of blocked pages non-public. The organization reminded that it is still possible to monitor blockings the old way through their website even if prohibited links do not appear there immediately, but with a slight delay.The actions of Roskomnadzor fit into the general trend towards increasing the secrecy of information in Russia. So, since the beginning of the war, your data and statistics classified has already been classified by more than a dozen departments. And yesterday it became known that the websites of Moscow courts have stopped showing what exactly people are being arrested for. According to ASTRA estimates, in total, from March to September, Russian planes dropped at least 128 aerial bombs on Russia and the occupied territories of Ukraine. FAB-250 and FAB-500 fall most often. Usually, during an emergency gathering, they do not explode - the bombs are destroyed after the fact by explosives technicians. At the beginning of July, FAB-3000 fell for the first time from a Russian plane in the Belgorod region. A bomb exploded in a field near Shebekino. Since the bomb fell in a field, there were no casualties. May 4 a Russian plane dropped a FAB-500 on Belgorod, as a result of which 7 people were injured, 31 households and 10 cars damaged. Title: 🖼 In Tajikistan, they are sewing uniforms for Russian military p...
Description: Uniforms are being sewn for Russian military personnel in TajikistanRadio Ozodi conducted an investigation and found out that the Russian group of companies -BTK Group- began to actively operate in Tajikistan with the beginning of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine. Over the past two years, the company has rented 5.5 thousand hectares of land in the country and invested in two textile factories (in Dushanbe and Khujand), which sewed military uniforms for Russian soldiers fighting with Ukraine. Journalists learned that in 2023, BTK Group purchased men's clothing, including military uniforms, and imported it to Russia for -SVO purposes.- The cost of the purchased goods was about $13 million. In the first four months of 2024, the company purchased clothing worth $4 million.BTK Group was founded in 2005 by Taimuraz Bolloev, one of Vladimir Putin’s close associates - he was twice his confidant in the presidential elections. In June 2024, the European Union imposed personal sanctions against Bolloev. The company came to Tajikistan in 2022. On February 25, 2022, the day after the invasion, Prime Minister of Tajikistan Kohir Rasulzoda met with the CEO of Baltika Group (part of the BTK Group holding) Mikhail Bocharov. The parties discussed such issues as -the creation of joint ventures and workshops, investment, final processing of products.-The company has a contract with the Russian Ministry of Defense, however, in 2023, Russian media reported multi-million dollar lawsuits from the ministry against BTK Group for the amount of 623 million rubles. According to the Ministry of Defense, BTK violated the delivery deadlines for products. The court found the claim to be justified, but the amount of the penalty was reduced to 983 thousand rubles.

Title: 🖼 -Come, we will crucify you-. A family of Russian oppositionist...
Description: -Come, we will crucify you.- A family of Russian oppositionists with five children is being deported from SwedenOlga Rogachevskikh, a chemist from Yekaterinburg, together with her husband Alexei and five children, the youngest of whom is now only six years old, left Russia after the start of the war. They publicly expressed their anti-war point of view, which caused them problems at work. -I am a pacifist and generally do not accept any military conflicts, much less attacks on the fraternal people, because every Russian has close and distant relatives in Ukraine. After the war, we were in a very stressful state, and we decided to leave, because we can’t change anything in Russia,- Olga told ASTRA.According to her, Sweden was the only country where where they could most quickly obtain visas and enter legally. In June 2022, they crossed the border and applied for asylum. A few months later, immediately after mobilization began, they received a refusal. Olga and her husband filed an appeal, which was considered for another six months.-In fact, migration clerks do not have a document by which they should evaluate Russians who opposed the war. In fact, they rely on outdated documents, according to which there is no war,- Olga claims.Olga says that she and her husband still found a way to suspend the decision on their deportation, but after 11 months they anyway, an order was issued to leave the country.-On August 1, I was absolutely illegally put in a pre-trial detention center. I am an asylum seeker, all my documents are legal, but since then they have not released me. I lived in migration housing, came and renewed my asylum seeker card. I was where I was supposed to be. If they suspected that I would run away, they should have forced me to report to come. But they missed this point and simply arrested me, separating me from my five children,- Olga told ASTRA.A review of the decision to place her in a pre-trial detention center in early October did not yield anything. i>-I am in the leaked FSB database -Oppositionists- because I have a small journalistic job. I wrote articles about anti-war organizations that are banned in Russia. I took part in rallies and demonstrations, wrote a book, and ran a telegram channel in which I told how to get asylum. Provocateurs are writing to my husband from the FSB,- Olga shares.She says what she saw asylum seekers from Belarus were deportedagainst whom criminal proceedings were initiated. According to Olga, the son from this family was arrested immediately at the border, and his mother stopped communicating. -I am now simply afraid for my life, because the latest paper says that nothing threatens us, there is no war in Yekaterinburg, everything is fine, the FSB will not touch us. And my interview was published on YouTube, there were 1100 comments. 80 percent of them - come, we will crucify you,- says Olga.Olga has now created petition asking the Swedish authorities to prevent her deportation. Scandinavian countries have repeatedly denied political asylum to Russians. So, Russian Pavel Suetin left Severomorsk for Norway and requested asylum in the city of Vadsø, but in September 2024, the Norwegian migration department informed him that he was not entitled to asylum and must leave the Schengen zone within three weeks. Title: 🖼 Russia is deceitfully recruiting young girls from Africa, Asia...
Description: Russia is deceiving young girls from Africa, Asia and Latin America to assemble Shaheds - Associated PressAbout 200 foreign women are assembling Iranian drones in the Alabuga special economic zone in Tatarstan. Girls aged 18–22 are attracted to Russia using the Alabuga Start online program: on the program’s website they are promised studies in Europe, a free plane and work in the service and catering sectors, but this turns out to be a hoax. As a result, girls face constant monitoring, broken wage promises, and dangerous work with caustic chemicals that damage their skin. -I regret and curse the day when I started doing this,- the publication quotes one of the women. Together with foreign women, 15-16-year-old Russian students of vocational schools work there, who also complain about working conditions. Analysts found that since July 29, about 95% of drones have not hit any visible targets in Ukraine. Instead, they fall into the rivers and fields of Ukraine, fly into Latvia and land on the territory of Russia or Belarus. Until July, about 14% of Shaheds hit targets in Ukraine. The publication writes that one of the reasons for the decline in the quality of drones may be unskilled labor. The special economic zone -Alabuga- was created in 2006 to attract business and investment to Tatarstan. After February 2022, it quickly grew and its parts switched to military production.
